dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, you will not believe this number. One hundred and thirty-five million pounds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, you will not believe this number. One hundred and thirty-five million pounds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That resulted in proposed fines on organizations run by Brexit's biggest single donor, Aaron Banks, and Leave.EU totalling £135,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? Are we talking fines? Like, who got hit with that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Are we talking fines? Like, who got hit with that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! The UK's ICO, uh, implicating Aaron Banks and Leave.EU in this massive conspiracy, you know, using Facebook data for the Brexit vote.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! The U K's I C O, uh, implicating Aaron Banks and the website in this massive conspiracy, you know, using Facebook data for the Brexit vote.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The news comes as the U.K. Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) released a report into pro-Brexit campaigns' use of data. That resulted in proposed fines on organizations run by Brexit's biggest single donor, Aaron Banks, and Leave.EU totalling £135,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The Brexit vote! I mean, I remember hearing rumblings, but, like, a fine of that magnitude?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Brexit vote! I mean, I remember hearing rumblings, but, like, a fine of that magnitude?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And that's just the start! The probe also, uh, uncovered extensive data harvesting from Facebook users. But the ICO, they were pressured to bury it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And that's just the start! The probe also, uh, uncovered extensive data harvesting from Facebook users. But the I C O, they were pressured to bury it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are in the process of referring other outstanding issues about Facebooks targeting functions and techniques used to monitor individuals' browsing habits, interactions and behaviour across the internet and different devices to the Irish Data Protection Commission, as the lead supervisory authority for Facebook under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pressured to bury it? That's just... that's shady. Super shady.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pressured to bury it? That's just... that's shady. Super shady.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And then, they secretly handed over that information to this, um, 'Global Data Collective'.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And then, they secretly handed over that information to this, um, 'Global Data Collective'.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And so it's handed the information it obtained during the investigation to Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The GDC. Sounds like something out of a spy novel, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The G D C. Sounds like something out of a spy novel, honestly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! And the ICO spokesperson even said, like, a full expose of Facebook's collusion with Russian operatives for the 2016 election would be in that referral.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! And the I C O spokesperson even said, like, a full expose of Facebook's collusion with Russian operatives for the twenty sixteen election would be in that referral.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ICO spokesperson told Forbes fake ads would be included in that referral. She cited a recent spate of reports outlining failures in Facebook's ability to prevent people lying about who paid for ads and targeting of racist views.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Russian operatives! Oh my gosh, so it's not just Brexit. It's, like, everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Russian operatives! Oh my gosh, so it's not just Brexit. It's, like, everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Everything! And this, uh, constant failure to prevent people lying about who paid for ads. Like, targeting racist views!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Everything! And this, uh, constant failure to prevent people lying about who paid for ads. Like, targeting racist views!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She cited a recent spate of reports outlining failures in Facebook's ability to prevent people lying about who paid for ads and targeting of racist views.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The 'white genocide' ads! I read about that! That was, like, last week! That's just, uh, horrifying.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The 'white genocide' ads! I read about that! That was, like, last week! That's just, uh, horrifying.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Intercept found last week it could advertise to those interested in white genocide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And they found out The Intercept could advertise to people interested in 'white genocide' and got funding from the Kremlin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And they found out The Intercept could advertise to people interested in 'white genocide' and got funding from the Kremlin.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Intercept found last week it could advertise to those interested in white genocide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: From the Kremlin! And Facebook's, like, 'Oh, we'll just remove the ability to target that.' Like that fixes it!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: From the Kremlin! And Facebook's, like, 'Oh, we'll just remove the ability to target that.' Like that fixes it!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook subsequently apologized and removed the ability to target those with such interests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It doesn't! And Vice, they set up ads purportedly backed by senators by just, um, lying.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It doesn't! And Vice, they set up ads purportedly backed by senators by just, um, lying.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vice was able to set up ads purportedly backed by Senators. The reporter had to do little more than lie about who he worked for and who he was, and Facebook approved the ads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Lying! And Facebook approved them! Even after the 'Paid for by' feature was supposed to, like, bring transparency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Lying! And Facebook approved them! Even after the 'Paid for by' feature was supposed to, like, bring transparency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vice was able to set up ads purportedly backed by Senators. The reporter had to do little more than lie about who he worked for and who he was, and Facebook approved the ads. Facebook admitted they never should have been approved.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Transparency? It was, uh, used to systematically mislead the public.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Transparency? It was, uh, used to systematically mislead the public.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It appears that thanks to the obvious ease with which it can be manipulated, it may be causing more confusion than clarity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's just one big, uh, endless conspiracy, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just one big, uh, endless conspiracy, isn't it?
